d137a13b-45b6-4ff7-b7f7-41d0c8e2d19e.description: This course help students understand the field of network security and how it relates to other areas of information technology. This course also provides the broad-based knowledge necessary to prepare for further study in specialized security fields, or it can serve as a capstone course that gives a general introduction to the field. The general course topics include mitigating threats, cryptography, securities, and authentication.
d137a13b-45b6-4ff7-b7f7-41d0c8e2d19e.name: CompTIA Security+

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: CompTIA Security+
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

12f58823-4301-4258-ae14-e30b16182787.description: The course objective is to provide network technicians and support staff with the foundation-level skills they need to install, operate, manage, maintain, and troubleshoot a corporate network. The general course topics include installing a corporate network; operating a corporate network; managing a corporate network; maintaining a corporate network; and troubleshooting a corporate network.
12f58823-4301-4258-ae14-e30b16182787.name: CompTIA Network+

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent.
Optional: CompTIA Network+ Certfication
This course qualifies for ACE education credits.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

152faf3e-a5e6-499d-8af5-68754858b337.description: Solidifies crucial fundamental concepts, principles, processes, and functions to enable successful IT Service Management, or ITSM. Students learn how to align IT with business, control IT costs, improve service, and balance IT resources. This course provides proven practical guidance and best practices on how to successfully introduce an integrated IT Service Management framework within an organization. ITIL® is a registered trademark of AXELOS Limited, used under permission of AXELOS Limited.
152faf3e-a5e6-499d-8af5-68754858b337.name: ITIL® Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs

Learning objectives include service strategy activities and processes, service design processes, service transition processes, service operation processes, and functions, continual service improvement.
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: ITIL® Foundation Certification
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

69df31bc-9ad0-477a-95ba-78dfc33c8a44.description: Students install, configure, optimize, troubleshoot, repair, upgrade, and perform preventive maintenance on personal computers, digital devices, and operating systems.
69df31bc-9ad0-477a-95ba-78dfc33c8a44.name: CompTIA A+ Core 1

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs

Topics include hardware & networking fundamentals; supporting display & mobile digital devices, printers, & multifunction devices; installing and configuring peripheral & system components; managing data storage; customizing client environment; networking technologies; installing and configuring networking capabilities.
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent.
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is part of a course sequence recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

bdf463d2-d25a-47fa-886f-d394ef4ea998.description: Students learn the basics of personal computer hardware and operating systems including installation, upgrade, repair, configuration, optimization, troubleshooting, and preventative maintenance. In addition, they learn how to support personal computers, mobile devices, and small networks in a business setting, including hardware and software troubleshooting,
bdf463d2-d25a-47fa-886f-d394ef4ea998.name: CompTIA A+ Core 2

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs.

Course topics include: operating systems; networking and security; safety and operational procedures; installing, configuring, optimizing, and maintaining Microsoft Windows; configuring networking capabilities; supporting mobile digital devices; security threats, vulnerabilities and controls; and troubleshooting systems.
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent.
Optional: CompTIA A+ Certification (In combination with A+ Essentials course)
This course qualifies for ACE education credits.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

313bab88-7612-4945-b900-42a715cfd545.description: The Ethical Hacker course immerses students into a hacker mindset where they are shown how to scan, test, hack, and secure systems. With a lab-intensive, interactive environment, students gain in-depth knowledge and practical experience with current essential security systems. They also gain valuable skills in penetration testing, security assessment, intrusion detection, social engineering, and more.
313bab88-7612-4945-b900-42a715cfd545.name: EC-Council Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs
The methods of assessment include participation and an end of class assessment with a minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: Certified Ethical Hacker Certification
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

3c9f0c4d-37c1-4ec7-a241-821c720e6575.description: The CND course trains entry-level network security administrators on defense-in-depth network security preparedness, and the "protect, detect, and respond" approach to network security. Students gain a detailed understanding and the hands-on ability to act in real-life situations involving network defense. Based on the National Initiative of Cybersecurity Education (NICE) framework, this course is mapped to Department of Defense (DoD) job roles for system and network administrators.
3c9f0c4d-37c1-4ec7-a241-821c720e6575.name: EC-Council Certified Network Defender (CND)

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: EC-Council Certified Network Defender (CND) Certification
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

0563fa2c-3504-457b-867a-6884cb549209.description: The CCNA (Network Administrator) program consists of two CCNA courses that develop the skills required to install, configure, operate, and troubleshoot small to medium-sized enterprise networks as well as resolve network connectivity issues. Students are prepared for the CCNA networking certification taken after part 2 (CCNA 2) so they can validate their knowledge and skills to current and potential employers.
0563fa2c-3504-457b-867a-6884cb549209.name: CCNA 1 (Network Administrator Part 1)

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: CCNA Certification (requires completion of CCNA parts 1 and 2)
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

6bf23cce-8574-4145-9634-475452fef2a2.description: Students learn how to improve the success rate of projects by applying a standardized and evolving set of project management principles from the nine knowledge areas and five process groups contained in the PMI® PMBOK® Guide
6bf23cce-8574-4145-9634-475452fef2a2.name: PMI Project Management Professional (PMP)

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: PMP Certification
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

8f82a7e8-39df-4fda-adac-3ba8be4c647d.description: A CISSP badge verifies a security professional's knowledge and excellence in the field of information security. CISSPs are information assurance professionals who define the architecture, design, management, and/or controls that assure the security of business environments. This course of study has prerequisites of five years of direct professional work experience or a college degree and four years of experience.
8f82a7e8-39df-4fda-adac-3ba8be4c647d.name: ISC2 Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs

Topics include access control; application development security; business continuity; cryptography; IS governance and risk management; legal, regulations, investigations and compliance; operations security; physical security; security architecture and design; and telecommunications and network security.
The methods of evaluation include participation and an assessment with a required minimum passing score of 70 percent
Optional: CISSP – Certified Information Systems Security Professional Certification
This course qualifies for ACE education credits

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

1b874a2e-8161-4f5d-be35-d7edddf684f3.description: The CCNA (Network Administrator) program consists of two CCNA courses that develop the skills required to install, configure, operate, and troubleshoot small to medium-sized enterprise networks as well as resolve network connectivity issues. Students are prepared for the CCNA networking certification (CCNA part 1 required) so they can validate their knowledge and skills to current and potential employers.
1b874a2e-8161-4f5d-be35-d7edddf684f3.name: CCNA 2 (Network Administrator Part 2)

badge_template_activities.title: Course completion consisting of 40 hours of immersive instruction with hands-on activities and labs

Optional: CCNA Certification (requires completion of CCNA parts 1 and 2)
This course qualifies for ACE education credits
